key_points: Reading schools were closed on Thursday due to a potential threat of violence from a student.
A 13-year-old student was arrested and charged with inducing panic following a school shooting threat.
District Superintendent Jason Enix and Reading police are investigating the threat.
The student was detained at the Hamilton County Juvenile Court Youth Center following arraignment.
The prosecution insists on holding the student, who is part of the National Honor Society, until the next court hearing.
The threat was spread through a Snapchat message warning students not to come to school.
Reading police deemed the threat credible and arrested the student involved.
Superintendent Enix notified parents of the situation and called for vigilance.
Classes are set to resume on Friday with additional police presence.
The incident is part of a wider pattern of threats against Tri-State school districts.
